content.description: Chimney into the dihedral long enough to take a deep breath and take on some awesome compression moves out the steepness. Take a moment at the decent rail and enjoy the mantle!
content.location: Head left once you hit the trailer park and look for the large impressive overhang.

content.description: A true Kelly canyon route. It's big. It's got commitment and it has every kind of hold Kelly has to offer.  The line follows the left side of the roof. Start on crimps at about eye level. Make your way up to the jug slots under the roof. From here look for a small patina crumpled for the left hand and a pocket/undercling for the right. Next move to the large sloper. Keep moving up staying under the roof till your on the crescent crimp. From here pull out onto the face and up the last few holds to the top. Unlike a lot of Kelly's top outs this one is easy.
content.location: Left side of pressure drops roof

content.description: The obvious large roof across from the warm up wall.
